newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk cenbank to demand identification of CD buyers.
newsitem.headline: Turk cenbank to demand identification of CD buyers.

text.p: Turkey's central bank said on Wednesday it decided to stop issuing certificates of deposit to customers whose identity is not disclosed as part of Turkish efforts to counter money laundering.
"At the central bank council meeting on Tuesday, January 28, it was decided to cease the practice of issuing certificates of deposit to unidentified customers," it said in a statement.
It said a government meeting last August included the issue of a customer's identity among proposals to combat money laundering.

The new regulation will become effective after a related central bank decree is published in the country's Official Gazette and existing certificates will remain valid until expiry, the statement said.
Turkey's parliament passed a law aimed at curbing money laundering in November as part of a fight against organised crime, particularly drug smuggling.
The law envisaged the creation of an authority to investigate financial crimes which would pass on its findings to public prosecutors.
